summary: This textbook provides an introduction to biotransformations for organic chemists and highlights the increasing use of enzymes in asymmetric synthesis, with about 15% of papers now employing biocatalytic methods.
key_claims: - The proportion of papers on the asymmetric synthesis of enantiopure compounds using biocatalytic methods has risen from zero in 1970 to about 8% by 1989 and is approaching 15% now.
